sen.j: 藤原 仲光（ふじわら の なかみつ、生没年不詳）は、平安時代中期の武士。
sen.e: FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the mid Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the mid Heian period.
FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu (year of birth and death unknown) was a samurai who lived during the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 藤原氏の流れを汲むと考えられるが、詳しい系譜は不明。
sen.e: It is considered that he followed the Fujiwara-clan but his detailed pedigree record is unknown.
It is considered that he followed the Fujiwara-clan but his detailed pedigree record is unknown.
It is considered that he followed the Fujiwara-clan but his detailed pedigree record is unknown.

sen.j: 一説によると藤原北家藤原秀郷流とされるが、伝説上の人物ともいわれている。
sen.e: One suggestion is that he was from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Hidesato house but it is also said that he was a legendary samurai.
One suggestion is that he was from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Hidesato house but it is also said that he was a legendary samurai.
One suggestion is that he was from the Northern House of the Fujiwara clan, FUJIWARA no Hidesato house but it is also said that he was a legendary samurai.

sen.j: 藤原仲義（塩川仲義）、幸寿丸らの父。
sen.e: He was the father of FUJIWARA no Nakayoshi (Nakayoshi SHIOKAWA), Kojumaru and others.
He was the father of FUJIWARA no Nakayoshi (Nakayoshi SHIOKAWA), Kojumaru and others.
He was the father of FUJIWARA no Nakayoshi (Nakayoshi SHIOKAWA), Kojumaru and others.

sen.j: 源満仲の家臣として仕え、満仲が都を離れて摂津国川辺郡多田盆地に入部したのに伴い、同国池田の地に土着したとされる。
sen.e: He served as a vassal of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and apparently settled Ikeda, Settsu Province as Mitsunaka entered the domain in Tada-bonchi Basin, Kawabe-gun, Settsu Province for the first time, having left Kyoto.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: He served as a vassal of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and apparently settled Ikeda, Settsu Province as Mitsunaka entered the domain in Tada-bonchi Basin, Kawabe-gun, Settsu Province for the first time, having left Kyoto.

He served as a vassal of MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and apparently settled Ikeda, Settsu Province as Mitsunaka entered the domain in Tada-bonchi Basin, Kawabe-gun, Settsu Province for the first time, having left Kyoto.

sen.j: 現在の大阪府池田市伏尾町の八幡城址は、仲光の居城跡だとする説がある。
sen.e: There is an explanation that ruins of Yawata-jo Castle in current Fushio-cho, Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture was the castle site where Nakamitsu used to live.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There is an explanation that ruins of Yawata-jo Castle in current Fushio-cho, Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture was the castle site where Nakamitsu used to live.
There is an explanation that ruins of Yawata-jo Castle in current Fushio-cho, Ikeda City, Osaka Prefecture was the castle site where Nakamitsu used to live.

sen.j: 藤原秀郷の一族を追捕している満仲が、なぜ秀郷の嫡流である仲光を郎等にしたのかは不明だが、源満仲と藤原仲光との間に起きた「美女丸・幸寿丸の事件」を機に、満仲が隠居した後、仲光は多田院の主代殿となるなど、初期清和源氏の発展に貢献したとされる。
sen.e: It is unclear why Mitsunaka who searched and captured the family of FUJIWARA no Hidesato accepted Nakamitsu who was a direct descendant of Hidesato as roto (retainer), however, after 'Incident of Bijomaru and Kojumaru' which had happened between MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu, Nakamitsu apparently contributed to the early development of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan originated from Emperor Seiwa), for example, having been 主代殿 of Tada-in Shrine after Mitsunaka had retired.
sen.cmt: インターネット・辞書等を用いて「主代殿」という語句を調べましたが、意味だけでなく読みさえも不明だったため、英訳も出来ませんでした。
sen.e: It is unclear why Mitsunaka who searched and captured the family of FUJIWARA no Hidesato accepted Nakamitsu who was a direct descendant of Hidesato as roto (retainer), however, after 'Incident of Bijomaru and Kojumaru' which had happened between MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu, Nakamitsu apparently contributed to the early development of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan originated from Emperor Seiwa), for example, having been 主代殿 of Tada-in Shrine after Mitsunaka had retired.

It is unclear why Mitsunaka who searched and captured the family of FUJIWARA no Hidesato accepted Nakamitsu who was a direct descendant of Hidesato as roto (retainer), however, after 'Incident of Bijomaru and Kojumaru' which had happened between MINAMOTO no Mitsunaka and FUJIWARA no Nakamitsu, Nakamitsu apparently contributed to the early development of Seiwa-Genji (Minamoto clan originated from Emperor Seiwa), for example, having been 主代殿 of Tada-in Shrine after Mitsunaka had retired.

sen.j: また、高野山奥之院に存在する満仲の供養塔は仲光によって建立されたものであると伝えられる。
sen.e: Also, it is said that Mitsunaka's memorial tower in Koyasan Mountain Oku-no-in Temple was erected by Nakamitsu.
Also, it is said that Mitsunaka's memorial tower in Koyasan Mountain Oku-no-in Temple was erected by Nakamitsu.
Also, it is said that Mitsunaka's memorial tower in Koyasan Mountain Oku-no-in Temple was erected by Nakamitsu.

sen.j: 後代、仲光は平安時代の代表的武人として伝説化され説話が残された（詳細は『美女丸伝説』を参照）。
sen.e: Later, Nakamitsu was legendized as a leading warrior in Heian period and a narrative has left. (For further details, refer to "The legend of Bijomaru".)
Later, Nakamitsu was legendized as a leading warrior in Heian period and the narrative thereof has left (For further details, refer to "The legend of Bijomaru").
sen.cmt: a narrative を the narrative thereof としました。
sen.e: Later, Nakamitsu was legendized as a leading warrior in Heian period and the narrative thereof has left (For further details, refer to "The legend of Bijomaru").

sen.j: 現在、清和源氏ゆかりの寺院である兵庫県川西市の満願寺 (川西市)や小童寺、同宝塚市の普明寺 (宝塚市)などの境内に美女丸・幸寿丸と共に仲光の供養塔が存在する。
sen.e: Currently there is Nakamitsu's memorial tower on the temple grounds in Mangan-ji Temple, which is associated with Seiwa-Genji, in Kawanishi City, Hyogo Prefecture, Shodo-ji Temple and Fumyo-ji Temple in Takarazuka City, Hyogo Prefecture as well as Bijomaru and Kojumaru.

Currently there is Nakamitsu's memorial tower on the temple grounds in Mangan-ji Temple, which is associated with Seiwa-Genji, in Kawanishi City, Hyogo Prefecture, Shodo-ji Temple and Fumyo-ji Temple in Takarazuka City, Hyogo Prefecture as well as Bijomaru and Kojumaru.

Currently there is Nakamitsu's memorial tower on the temple grounds in Mangan-ji Temple, which is associated with Seiwa-Genji, in Kawanishi City, Hyogo Prefecture, Shodo-ji Temple and Fumyo-ji Temple in Takarazuka City, Hyogo Prefecture as well as Bijomaru and Kojumaru.

sen.j: 仲光の後裔を称する氏族として、出羽池田氏や多田院御家人の筆頭として知られる塩川氏などがある。
sen.e: The clans refered to Nakamitsu's descendant are the Dewa Ikeda clan, the Shiokawa clan known as a head of Tadain gokenin(vassals of Tada-in shirine) and others.
The clans refered to Nakamitsu's descendant are the Dewa Ikeda clan, the Shiokawa clan known as a head of Tadain gokenin(vassals of Tada-in shirine) and others.
